title: Projects
text:
This report ,and subsequent code was created as part of a class project in Applications in Greenhouse Gas Accounting. This project uses IPCC Tier 1 methods to calculate emissions associated with California Dairy operations in 2018,2020, and 2022.
This project will have a secondary part that will outline a mitigation analysis , based on linear regression extrapolation from historical data.
To complete this project a function was created in R which generated total emissions from dairy operations and had arguments for number of cows, counties and associated IPCC emission factors. Uncertainty was accounted for and a monte carlo analysis was performed to calculate these emission estimates to include uncertainty.


California.Results.Total<- "DairyEmissions"(input.filename= "545_ef_data.csv",county=48, nyears= 3 ,iseed=208784, nreps = 10000 , ef= 128, ef1= 58, ef3=.005,ef5=.0075, ef4=.01, ms=.263,
nex=97.0024, fracgas.ms=0.3, fracgas.n=.2 , EF01= .03, fracleach=.3) 



# input.filename - Name of file with activity data, which is a comma delimited file with the input activity data in columns along with a header row as follows: Number of Cows, and all emission factors with standard deviation, max CO2 emissions factor, CH4 emission factor, min CH4 emission, max CH4 emission factor, N2O emission factor, min N2O emission factor, max N2O emissions factor, fuel amount for year 1 (TJ), standard deviation for fuel amount, . . . for all years #county Number of counties in input file #nyears Number of years of data
#iseed Initial seed value for random draws
#nreps Number of Monte Carlo iterations #ef EF from table 10.11 Enteric Fermentation
#ef1 Ef from table 10.14 Manure Mgmt
#ef3 Ef from table 10.21 Manure Mgmt
#ef4 Ef from table 11.3 Soil N20
#ef5 Ef from table 11.3 Soil N20
#EF01 Ef from table 11.1 Soil N20
#ms fraction of total annual nitrogen excretion for each livestock species/category T that is managed
in manure management system S in the country, dimensionless #nex annual average N excretion per head of species/category T in the country, kg N animal-1 yr-1, equation 10.30
#fracgas.ms percent of managed manure nitrogen for livestock category T that volatilises as NH3 and NOx in the manure management system S, %, Table 10.22 #fracgas.n Volatilisation from all organic N fertilisers applied, Table # 11.3
#frac leach Leach/Runoff from all organic N fertilisers applied, Table 11.3

title: Gabriella Scolio
text:
This is a Quarto website. Created as part of a class assignment for Ecosystem Science and Sustainability class 523. The work on this website was authored by Gabriella Scolio.
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

title: About
text:
I am a current Masterâ€™s student at Colorado State University studying Greenhouse Gas Accounting and Carbon Management. I aspire to promote equitable systems and limit greenhouse gas emissions while prioritizing the health of our ecosystems.

About this site

title: 523 Assignments
text: These assignments were part of a graduate level data science class. Taught by Matt Ross, Caitlyn Mothes, and Katie Willie. This class was taken as part of my required Ecosystem Science and Sustainability coursework for the Professional Science Masters. I am currently enrolled in the second half of this course where we are working on writing a report, and conducting a data analysis on cropland diversity and farm size in the United States. This portion of the course is taught by Nathan Mueller.
